author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Tamil Nadu Tourism Award, in recognition of Kadambavanam, an ethnic resort located at Parali on the Madurai-Natham Road, as the Best Rural Tourism Project, was presented to Chitra Ganapathy, its Managing Director, at a function organised in Chennai on Friday.

The award, instituted away by Madura Welcome, publishers of tourist guide, and supported by Incredible India, an initiative of the Union Ministry of Tourism, is presented to recognise, encourage, stimulate and motivate the major stakeholders of Tamil Nadu tourism industry.

The objective of Kadambavanam, according to Ms. Chitra, is to preserve, conserve and perpetuate the living traditions of Tamils through a set of activities at its ethnic resort and cultural centre. Visitors will have a taste of Tamil culture, heritage, food and art forms of Tamil Nadu at the resort. Kadambavanam plans to start a wellness centre soon to offer naturopathy and yoga lessons.
title: Award for Kadambavanam
